uk.ac.soton.simulation.jsit.core

Class StandardStochasticAccessor<S extends AbstractStochasticItem>

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.soton.simulation.jsit.core.AbstractStochasticAccessInfo
      • uk.ac.soton.simulation.jsit.core.StandardStochasticAccessor<S>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class StandardStochasticAccessor<S extends AbstractStochasticItem>
extends AbstractStochasticAccessInfo
implements java.io.Serializable
    'Default' stochastic accessor using MDC keys---as Logback does--- to track stochastic items per run.
    Since:
    0.2
    Author:
    Stuart Rossiter
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StandardStochasticAccessor(java.lang.Class<?> owner, java.lang.String id)
      Create an 'empty' accessor, normally held statically to access the per-run stochastic item across all instances of the class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • StandardStochasticAccessor

        public StandardStochasticAccessor(java.lang.Class<?> owner,
                                  java.lang.String id)
        Create an 'empty' accessor, normally held statically to access the per-run stochastic item across all instances of the class.
        Parameters:
        owner - The class owning (using) the stochastic item.
        id - A user-provided ID to define this stochastic item (used in stochastic control configuration files together with the owning class name).
        Since:
        0.1

    • Method Detail

      • registerAccessorFreeStochItem

        public static void registerAccessorFreeStochItem(java.lang.Class<?> owner,
                                                 java.lang.String id,
                                                 AbstractStochasticItem stochItem)
        Register a stochastic item for use without an accessor for access. This should only be done when using the item with singleton model classes (where it does not have to be shared between instances), and holding it as an instance field (i.e., not statically).
        Parameters:
        owner - The class owning (using) the stochastic item.
        id - A user-provided ID to define this stochastic item (used in stochastic control configuration files together with the owning class name).
        stochItem - The stochastic item to register.
        Since:
        0.2

      • addForRun

        public void addForRun(S stochItem)

        removeMe in class AbstractStochasticAccessInfo
